Description of incident: "Orangeburg-Calhoun Technical College  in South Carolina is notifying 20,000 former and current students and  faculty members that an unencrypted laptop computer stolen this month  from a staff member's office contained their personal information."The information contained on the laptops included names, birth dates and Social Security numbers of individuals.The college stated that the information goes back 6 or 7 years and that they believe the thief was after the hardware, not the data stored on it. The college neglected to comment on whether or not they are providing credit monitoring services for those affected.
